note.p: Birth: Halesworth, Suffolk, England (30 June 1817)
Death: His house at Sunningdale, Berkshire (10 December 1911)
Burial: Kew, Surrey
Research Field: Botany
Education: Glasgow University. MD (1839)

Career: Went to the Antarctic on the "Erebus" under Sir James Clark Ross (FRS 1828) (1839-1843), during which voyage he visited New Zealand (1841); Botanist to the Geological Survey (1845); sent to explore the central and eastern Himalaua (1848-1849); explored Sikhim, parts of eastern Nepal and the passes of Tibet; botanical expedition to east Bengal with Thomas Thomson (FRS 1855) (1850); Assistant Director, Kew Gardens (1855); Director, Kew Gardens (1865); published, with George Bentham (FRS 1862) "Genera plantarum" (from 1862); President, British Association (1868); retired to Sunningdale (1885)
Honours: CB 1869; KCSI 1877; GCSI 1897; OM 1907
Memberships: Hon RSNZ (1870)
Membership: Fellow
Election Date: 22/04/1847
Medals/Prizes: Royal Medal 1854; Copley Medal 1887; Darwin Medal 1892
